Authors: qi jia zhang, Ying Zhang, Min Shen
Title:
Venturia fuliginosa sp. nov., a soot-like species of Venturia
(Venturiales) on Salix from China
Keywords:
Key words: follicolous fungi; phytopathogen; sooty molds;
taxonomy
Abstract:
Abstract: Opportunistic collecting of ascomycetes in
Lesser Khingan Mountains of China led to the discovery of two species of
Venturia from Salix spp, one of which is described and illustrated as a
new speciesÔºçV. fuliginosa. Venturia fuliginosa forms a soot-like
phenotype on the leaf surface of the host, and differs from known
species of Venturia in having fusiform, subcylindrical, sometimes
obpyriform and mostly aseptate conidia. Phylogenetic inferences based on
the combined sequences of the 28S and ITS rRNA gene repeat from nuc rDNA
indicate that the new species is closely related to CBS 470.61 (a strain
named V. chlorospora from Salix daphnoides in 1958 in France). Venturia
catenospora is reported for the first time in China.
